noun.description: A rounded lump or ball, especially at the end or on the surface of something.

phrases: This is Russian late-Romanticism with knobs on, grandiose choral and orchestral effects with the occasional touch of harmonic spice, that seem to belong more in some Hollywood epic than a concert hall.
I think this is best described as shooting yourself in the foot, with knobs on!
Rifkind said: This confirms our worst fears with knobs on.
Still, if a referee is going to fall for that kind of prima-donnish behaviour you might as well give it to him with knobs on!
origin: Late Middle English: from Middle Low German knobbe knot, knob, bud.
